newsitem.title: USA: Munnell says some Q4 exports were one time items.
newsitem.headline: Munnell says some Q4 exports were one time items.

text.p: Alicia Munnell, a member of the President's Council of Economic Advisers, said Friday that that the jump in the Gross Domestic Product in the fourth quarter resulted in part from a surge in exports, but some overseas sales were "one-shot" affairs.
Speaking to reporters, Munnell said that the consumer, who also helped buoy the fourth quarter activity, was the key to growth during 1997.
"There were big items; they were airplanes and other sort of lumpy things that probably made the fourth quarter growth higher than you can expect on a steady basis," she said.
Looking for the source of economic strength in the first quarter and throughout 1997, Munnell said that the consumer held the key.
"For that we really look to the consumer," she said. "The consumer is in remarkably good shape and we expect the consumer to be a major source throughout the 1997 period."
